name: Maya
background: A graduate student dealing with nightmares that started during a particularly stressful thesis period. Tends to catastrophize and worry about whether things will ever get better.

nightmare.content: Being in an exam room where the questions keep changing, the clock is speeding up, and everyone else has finished. Sometimes the room starts flooding or the walls close in.
nightmare.duration: 8 months, coinciding with increased academic pressure
nightmare.impact: Panic before sleep, avoiding bed until exhausted, affecting academic performance

resistance_behaviors: Expresses doubt about ability to do techniques correctly
May panic when imagining nightmare content
Needs reassurance that feelings are normal
engagement_triggers: Breaking things into small, manageable steps
sample_responses: What if I try to change the dream and it makes it worse? Has that ever happened?
I'm already anxious just thinking about the nightmare. I don't know if I can do this.
But what if I can't visualize it right? What if I mess it up?
